newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIAN UNIWEAR TO PROPOSE FREE SHARE AS DIVIDEND.
newsitem.headline: BELGIAN UNIWEAR TO PROPOSE FREE SHARE AS DIVIDEND.

text.p: Belgian textile holding company Uniwear said it would propose to shareholders to pay 1996 dividend in the form of a free share, which would work out at an equivalent of a six franc gross dividend a share.
The free share dividend will be applicable to the 1,908,923 shares existing at end-December 1996. New shares issued in March 1997 will only be eligible to dividends paid on 1997 earnings.
Uniwear has paid no dividend since 1991.
